body.p:
Bowling Green, Ky. Aug 27th 1864
Gov Thos. E. Bramlette
Frankfort. Ky --

We your petitioners, confectioners in the Town of Bowling Green Ky. would respectfully represent that some months ago, in the course of our business we sold a few packages of playing cards, without previously taking out the license required by the Statutes. we committed no willful breach of the law, as we were not at the time aware of the duty incumbent upon us to procure said license. At the last term of the Warren circuit Court, we made no opposition to the indictment found against us, and were fined $50 25/100 and costs. We earnestly petition your Excellency to remit so much of the assd fine, as you have the constitutional power to do.

We the undersigned citizens of Bowling Green Ky, personally acquainted with the above petitinoers Art & Sloyer, beg leave to state that we know them to be clever, law-abiding men and of
moderate means, and we therefore recommend them as deserving of executive clemency, and join in the prayer of their foregoing petition.

S. S Potter
L L Cooke
Rodes & Loving
P.. Hines Police Judge
Geo. C. Rogers

Warren Cir Ct
